lines.content: * Initializes the application and starts the interaction with the user.

+ "Adds an event task to the list";

+ ": Displays all persons in the address book as a list with index numbers.";

* @param str Storage that holds the task information.
* @param cmd Command string to be executed.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD
+ "Adds a todo task to the list";
* @param th Task Handler that handles the operation.
* @param str Storage that holds the task information.
* @param cmd Command string to be executed.
* Class that contains the tasklist and handles all tasklist operations.
* Prints the number of tasks in the tasklist.
* Marks the task at the given task index as done.
* @param taskNo Task index of the task.
* Deletes the task at the given task index.
* @param taskNo Task index of the task.
* Adds a To Do task to the tasklist.
* @param todo ToDo task to be added.
* Adds a deadline task to the tasklist.
* @param deadline Deadline task to be added.
* Adds an event task to the tasklist.
* @param event Event task to be added.
* Formats the tasklist to be put into storage.
* @return A string of the formatted tasklist.
* Class that signals an error that Duke may encounter.
* @param message should contain relevant information on the failed execution(s).
* Class that encapsulates all user-visible messages.
public static final String WELCOME_MESSAGE = "Hello! I'm Jacky\nWhat can I do for you?";
public static final String BYE_MESSAGE = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
public static final String UNKNOWN_INPUT_MESSAGE = "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(";
public static final String MISSING_DATE = "OOPS!!! Please add a valid date in the format dd/MM/yy HHmm.";
public static final String PRINT_LIST_MESSAGE = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
public static final String NUMBER_OF_TASKS_MESSAGE = "Now you have %d tasks in the list.\n";
public static final String MARK_TASK_AS_DONE_MESSAGE = "Nice! I've marked this task as done: ";
public static final String ADD_TASK = "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + INDENTATION + INDENTATION;
public static final String DELETE_TASK = "Noted. I've removed this task: ";
public static final String EMPTY_LIST = "You haven't added anything to your list!";
* Class that represents a Deadline task.
private final DateTimeFormatter input = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd/MM/yy HHmm");
private final DateTimeFormatter output = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd h:mm a");
* @param by Date the task is due.
* Formats the due date to the desirable format.
* @return A string representing the date in the desirable format.
* Returns the string representation of the Deadline task.
* Class that represents an Event task.
private final DateTimeFormatter input = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd/MM/yy HHmm");
private final DateTimeFormatter output = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd h:mm a");
* Formats the event date to the desirable format.
* @return A string representing the date in the desirable format.
* Returns the string representation of the Event task.
* Retrieves the done status of the task.
* @return string representation of the done status of the task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* Class that represents a To Do task.
* Returns the string representation of the To Do task.
* Class that makes sense of the user commands to Duke.
* Class that deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file.
* @param filePath The filepath of the stored file.
* Loads the tasks from the file.
* @throws DukeException if the tasks cannot be loaded.
* Updates the file according to the tasklist.
* @param tasks String representatio of all tasks.
* @throws DukeException if unexpected error is encountered.
public void updateFile(String tasks) throws DukeException {
* Returns a task that corresponds with the string description of the task.
* @param task String representation of the task to be returned.
* @return A task that corresponds with the string description of the task.
* @throws DukeException if task cannot be identified.
public Task taskFormatter(String task) throws DukeException {
* Class that deals with interactions with the user of Duke.
* Informs the user that they have inputted an empty task.
* @return The error message to the user.
error = Messages.INDENTATION + "OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.";
error = Messages.INDENTATION + "OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.";
error = Messages.INDENTATION + "OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.";
* Informs the user that they have entered an unidentifiable command.
* Informs the user that they have not entered a valid date.
* Informs the user that list has been printed.
* Informs the user the number of tasks on their list.
* Informs the user that the task has been marked as done.
* Informs the user that the task has been added.
* Informs the user that the task has been deleted.
assertEquals("    OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.", Ui.emptyDescription("event"));
